description.para: Calls the Amazon Augmented AI (A2I) Runtime StartHumanLoop API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2020 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: Starts a human loop, provided that at least one activation condition is met.
The name of the human loop.

Declares that your content is free of personally identifiable information or adult content. Amazon SageMaker can restrict the Amazon Mechanical Turk workers who can view your task based on this information.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the flow definition associated with this human loop.
Serialized input from the human loop. The input must be a string representation of a file in JSON format.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.StartHumanLoopResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.StartHumanLoopResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the HumanLoopName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^HumanLoopName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

Declares that your content is free of personally identifiable information or adult content. Amazon SageMaker can restrict the Amazon Mechanical Turk workers who can view your task based on this information.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the flow definition associated with this human loop.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
Serialized input from the human loop. The input must be a string representation of a file in JSON format.
The name of the human loop.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the HumanLoopName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^HumanLoopName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.StartHumanLoopResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.StartHumanLoopResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

This cmdlet returns an Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.StartHumanLoopResponse object containing multiple properties. The object can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
Calls the Amazon Augmented AI (A2I) Runtime ListHumanLoops API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2020 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para:
Returns information about human loops, given the specified parameters. If a human loop was deleted, it will not be included.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.
(Optional) The timestamp of the date when you want the human loops to begin in ISO 8601 format. For example, 2020-02-24.
(Optional) The timestamp of the date before which you want the human loops to begin in ISO 8601 format. For example, 2020-02-24.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a flow definition.
Optional. The order for displaying results. Valid values: Ascending and Descending.

The total number of items to return. If the total number of available items is more than the value specified in MaxResults, then a NextToken is returned in the output. You can use this token to display the next page of results.

A token to display the next page of results.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'HumanLoopSummaries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.ListHumanLoopsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.ListHumanLoopsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.
(Optional) The timestamp of the date when you want the human loops to begin in ISO 8601 format. For example, 2020-02-24.
(Optional) The timestamp of the date before which you want the human loops to begin in ISO 8601 format. For example, 2020-02-24.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a flow definition.

The total number of items to return. If the total number of available items is more than the value specified in MaxResults, then a NextToken is returned in the output. You can use this token to display the next page of results.

A token to display the next page of results.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'HumanLoopSummaries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.ListHumanLoopsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.ListHumanLoopsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
Optional. The order for displaying results. Valid values: Ascending and Descending.

This cmdlet returns a collection of Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.HumanLoopSummary objects. The service call response (type Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.ListHumanLoopsResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
Calls the Amazon Augmented AI (A2I) Runtime StopHumanLoop API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2020 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: The name of the human loop that you want to stop.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.StopHumanLoopResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the HumanLoopName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^HumanLoopName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The name of the human loop that you want to stop.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the HumanLoopName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^HumanLoopName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.StopHumanLoopResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

This cmdlet does not generate any output.The service response (type Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.StopHumanLoopResponse) can be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
Calls the Amazon Augmented AI (A2I) Runtime DescribeHumanLoop API operation.

description.para: Returns information about the specified human loop.
The name of the human loop that you want information about.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.DescribeHumanLoopResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.DescribeHumanLoopResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the HumanLoopName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^HumanLoopName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
The name of the human loop that you want information about.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the HumanLoopName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^HumanLoopName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.DescribeHumanLoopResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.DescribeHumanLoopResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

This cmdlet returns an Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.DescribeHumanLoopResponse object containing multiple properties. The object can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
Calls the Amazon Augmented AI (A2I) Runtime DeleteHumanLoop API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2020 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: Deletes the specified human loop for a flow definition.
The name of the human loop that you want to delete.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.DeleteHumanLoopResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the HumanLoopName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^HumanLoopName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The name of the human loop that you want to delete.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the HumanLoopName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^HumanLoopName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.DeleteHumanLoopResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

This cmdlet does not generate any output.The service response (type Amazon.AugmentedAIRuntime.Model.DeleteHumanLoopResponse) can be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
